title: Authors and Citation
text: Mike Irvine. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Irvine M (2025). pss.model.comparison: Results PSS Model Comparison Study. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pss.model.comparison: Results of PSS Model Comparison Study},   author = {Mike Irvine},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://sempwn.github.io/pss-model-comparison/}, }

what: Results of PSS Model Comparison Study
title: Results of PSS Model Comparison Study
text: goal pss.model.comparison …

title: Results of PSS Model Comparison Study
text: can install development version pss.model.comparison GitHub :

title: Results of PSS Model Comparison Study
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(pss.model.comparison) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

text: calculate deaths overdoses averted

title: calculate deaths and overdoses averted — add_averted_columns
calculate deaths and overdoses averted — add_averted_columns
text: model_data data frame containing model output. Must include columns: date: Date object, year_quarter: grouping variable (e.g., "2021 Q2"), model: model identifier, run: simulation run identifier, along numeric variables summarized.

title: calculate deaths and overdoses averted — add_averted_columns
text: tibble

what: Summarize Model Data by Year-Quarter — calculate_year_quarter_data
title: Summarize Model Data by Year-Quarter — calculate_year_quarter_data
text: Filters, groups, summarizes model output data year-quarter, model, run.

title: Summarize Model Data by Year-Quarter — calculate_year_quarter_data
Summarize Model Data by Year-Quarter — calculate_year_quarter_data
text: model_data data frame containing model output. Must include columns: date: Date object, year_quarter: grouping variable (e.g., "2021 Q2"), model: model identifier, run: simulation run identifier, along numeric variables summarized.

title: Summarize Model Data by Year-Quarter — calculate_year_quarter_data
text: grouped summarized tibble one row per combination year_quarter, model, run. non-Date columns summed. year_quarter returned factor.

title: Summarize Model Data by Year-Quarter — calculate_year_quarter_data
text: function takes data frame model output, filters dates March 1, 2020, groups data year_quarter, model, run, sums numeric (non-Date) columns within groups. year_quarter variable converted factor.

title: Summarize Model Data by Year-Quarter — calculate_year_quarter_data

what: Load and Combine BCROM and OTEM Model Output Data — load_data
title: Load and Combine BCROM and OTEM Model Output Data — load_data
text: function reads CSV files containing output BCROM OTEM models, processes combines data single tibble. adds model column distinguish data sources constructs date column year month columns.

title: Load and Combine BCROM and OTEM Model Output Data — load_data
Load and Combine BCROM and OTEM Model Output Data — load_data
text: round character, either "one" "two"

title: Load and Combine BCROM and OTEM Model Output Data — load_data
text: tibble containing combined data BCROM OTEM models, added model column parsed date column.

title: Load and Combine BCROM and OTEM Model Output Data — load_data
text: function expects files BCROM_comparison_outputs.csv OTEM_comparison_outputs.csv located data/raw/ relative project root, determined package. following transformations applied: ...1 column removed BCROM dataset present. model column added values "bcrom" "otem". date column constructed combining year month dummy day "01".

title: Load and Combine BCROM and OTEM Model Output Data — load_data

what: Load and combine sensitivity analysis data from OTEM and BCROM models — load_sensitivity_analysis_data
title: Load and combine sensitivity analysis data from OTEM and BCROM models — load_sensitivity_analysis_data
text: function loads sensitivity analysis data two modeling frameworks (OTEM BCROM), standardizes variable names, merges unified structure corresponding axis labels plotting analysis.

title: Load and combine sensitivity analysis data from OTEM and BCROM models — load_sensitivity_analysis_data
Load and combine sensitivity analysis data from OTEM and BCROM models — load_sensitivity_analysis_data
text: named list sensitivity analysis results, element list containing: data combined tibble OTEM BCROM results, including columns x_scale, y_scale, total_deaths, model. x_label character string describing x-axis label scenario. y_label character string describing y-axis label scenario. list keyed scenario identifiers (e.g., "pop_mort", "oat_ret").

title: Load and combine sensitivity analysis data from OTEM and BCROM models — load_sensitivity_analysis_data
text: function ensures OTEM BCROM provide matching sensitivity data tables scenario. attaches appropriate x y axis labels dataset downstream use figures reports.

what: Plot cumulative deaths averted across models and runs — plot_deaths_averted_lines
title: Plot cumulative deaths averted across models and runs — plot_deaths_averted_lines
text: function takes simulated model output produces line plot cumulative deaths averted time. Deaths averted calculated difference number drug-related deaths counterfactual scenario PSS number deaths PSS intervention. results grouped model simulation run, cumulative sums plotted semi-transparent lines visualize uncertainty across runs.

title: Plot cumulative deaths averted across models and runs — plot_deaths_averted_lines
Plot cumulative deaths averted across models and runs — plot_deaths_averted_lines
text: model_data data frame containing model simulation output following required columns: date — time variable (Date numeric). PSS drug_deaths — number deaths counterfactual scenario PSS intervention. PSS drug_deaths — number deaths PSS intervention scenario. model — model identifier (factor character). run — simulation run identifier (numeric character).

title: Plot cumulative deaths averted across models and runs — plot_deaths_averted_lines
text: ggplot object showing cumulative deaths averted time, stratified model multiple simulation runs shown faint lines.

title: Plot cumulative deaths averted across models and runs — plot_deaths_averted_lines
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example model data (toy example) df <- data.frame(   date = rep(seq.Date(as.Date("2020-01-01"), by = "month", length.out = 12), 2),   `no PSS drug_deaths` = rpois(24, 10),   `PSS drug_deaths` = rpois(24, 7),   model = rep(c("Model A", "Model B"), each = 12),   run = rep(1:2, each = 12) )  plot_deaths_averted_lines(df) } # }

title: Plot Model Difference Heatmap — plot_model_difference_heatmap
text: Creates bivariate heatmap comparing difference total deaths two models ("OTEM" "BCROM"), including custom legend laid 3x3 grid.

title: Plot Model Difference Heatmap — plot_model_difference_heatmap
Plot Model Difference Heatmap — plot_model_difference_heatmap
text: result list containing OAT results x_label, y_label, x_tick_labels, y_tick_labels, data. sensitivity_analysis Optional name element within result containing OAT results. Can either "pop_mort" "oat_ret" Defaults "oat_ret". breaks vector length 4 define small, medium, large categories, default NULL

title: Plot Model Difference Heatmap — plot_model_difference_heatmap
text: patchwork object combining main heatmap custom legend.

what: Plot Outcome by Year-Quarter and Model — plot_outcome_by_quarter
title: Plot Outcome by Year-Quarter and Model — plot_outcome_by_quarter
text: Creates boxplot specified outcome variable year_quarter, grouped colored model. useful comparing outcomes (e.g., overdose deaths) across different models time.

title: Plot Outcome by Year-Quarter and Model — plot_outcome_by_quarter
Plot Outcome by Year-Quarter and Model — plot_outcome_by_quarter
text: plot_data data frame containing least columns year_quarter, specified outcome, model. year_quarter column factor character indicating time periods, model specify model group. outcome character string specifying name outcome column plot_data plotted. Defaults "PSS drug_deaths".

title: Plot Outcome by Year-Quarter and Model — plot_outcome_by_quarter
text: ggplot2 object representing boxplot specified outcome year_quarter model.

title: Plot Outcome by Year-Quarter and Model — plot_outcome_by_quarter
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot_data <- data.frame(   year_quarter = rep(c("2020 Q1", "2020 Q2"), each = 10),   model = rep(c("Model A", "Model B"), times = 10),   `PSS drug_deaths` = rpois(20, 10) ) plot_outcome_by_quarter(plot_data) } # }

title: Plot sensitivity analysis heatmaps — plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap
text: function generates heatmap visualization sensitivity analysis results, showing impact varying model parameters total deaths (another outcome) given model. Positive values represent deaths averted, negative values represent deaths abetted. heatmap uses diverging color scale (red white blue) qualitative legend labels interpretability.

title: Plot sensitivity analysis heatmaps — plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap
code: plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap(   result,   sensitivity_analysis = "oat_ret",   model_name = "otem",   breaks = NULL )

title: Plot sensitivity analysis heatmaps — plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap
text: result list containing sensitivity analysis outputs. Must include element named according sensitivity_analysis contains: data: data frame columns model, x_scale, y_scale, total_deaths. x_label, y_label: Character strings axis labels. x_tick_labels, y_tick_labels: Optional vectors tick labels x y axes. sensitivity_analysis Character string specifying sensitivity analysis result use result. Defaults "oat_ret". model_name Character string specifying model plot within sensitivity analysis data. Defaults "otem". breaks Numeric vector length 2 giving minimum maximum values color scale. NULL (default), limits determined observed range category (.e., reversed total deaths).

title: Plot sensitivity analysis heatmaps — plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap
text: ggplot object representing sensitivity analysis heatmap.

title: Plot sensitivity analysis heatmaps — plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap
text: function filters sensitivity analysis data specified model, reverses sign total deaths positive values indicate deaths averted, assigns integer indices x y positions. diverging color gradient used, centered zero, red corresponding abetted (negative) blue corresponding averted (positive) values. legend includes qualitative labels ("Abetted -" "Averted +") along numeric range, aiding interpretation model outcomes.

title: Plot sensitivity analysis heatmaps — plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example usage: result <- list(   oat_ret = list(     data = data.frame(       model = "otem",       x_scale = rep(1:3, each = 3),       y_scale = rep(1:3, 3),       total_deaths = rnorm(9)     ),     x_label = "Parameter A",     y_label = "Parameter B",     x_tick_labels = c("Low", "Med", "High"),     y_tick_labels = c("Low", "Med", "High")   ) )  plot_sensitivity_analysis_heatmap(result) } # }

what: Process data for sensitivity analysis plotting — process_twsa_data
title: Process data for sensitivity analysis plotting — process_twsa_data
text: Takes TWSA result object formats tibble x_scale y_scale coordinates covering full square grid -1 1, suitable plotting twsa_heatmap_plot().

title: Process data for sensitivity analysis plotting — process_twsa_data
Process data for sensitivity analysis plotting — process_twsa_data
text: data_obj data frame matrix containing TWSA result values, columns n_inc_odf_scaled n_inc_odn_scaled.

title: Process data for sensitivity analysis plotting — process_twsa_data
text: tibble columns: x_scale — numeric x-coordinate grid y_scale — numeric y-coordinate grid n_inc_odf_scaled — scaled incremental overdoses (ODF) n_inc_odn_scaled — scaled incremental overdoses (ODN) incremental_overdoses_scaled — total scaled incremental overdoses

title: Process data for sensitivity analysis plotting — process_twsa_data
text: function generates 17x17 grid (289 points) plotting, corresponding combinations x y scaling factors -1 1. column incremental_overdoses_scaled computed sum n_inc_odf_scaled n_inc_odn_scaled.

what: Summarize model outputs by year and quarter — summarise_year_quarter_data
title: Summarize model outputs by year and quarter — summarise_year_quarter_data
text: Aggregates quarterly model results (overdoses deaths) across simulations parameter draws using median associated uncertainty interval. summary provides concise quarterly view modeled outcomes output calculate_year_quarter_data().

title: Summarize model outputs by year and quarter — summarise_year_quarter_data
Summarize model outputs by year and quarter — summarise_year_quarter_data
text: year_quarter_data data frame tibble returned calculate_year_quarter_data(), containing simulated quarterly outcomes columns year_quarter, model, PSS overdoses, PSS overdoses, PSS drug_deaths, PSS drug_deaths, cumulative measures deaths overdoses averted.

title: Summarize model outputs by year and quarter — summarise_year_quarter_data
text: tibble summarizing median (uncertainty) estimates model year-quarter combination. Includes following columns: year_quarter Year-quarter identifier (e.g., "2024-Q2"). model Model name identifier (e.g., "BCROM", "OTEM"). PSS overdoses Median uncertainty interval overdoses PSS scenario. PSS overdoses Median uncertainty interval overdoses counterfactual (PSS) scenario. PSS drug_deaths Median uncertainty interval overdose deaths PSS scenario. PSS drug_deaths Median uncertainty interval overdose deaths counterfactual (PSS) scenario. cumulative deaths averted Cumulative estimate overdose deaths averted PSS implementation. cumulative overdoses averted Cumulative estimate overdoses averted PSS implementation. tibble summarized quarterly model results.

title: Summarize model outputs by year and quarter — summarise_year_quarter_data
text: function groups results year_quarter model, applies median uncertainty column, returns subset key outcome variables reporting visualization.

what: Create a Sensitivity Analysis heatmap plot — twsa_heatmap_plot
title: Create a Sensitivity Analysis heatmap plot — twsa_heatmap_plot
text: Generates heatmap Tornado-Waterfall Sensitivity Analysis (TWSA) results, visualizing changes outcomes across 2D parameter space. fill colour represents specified variable, labels added grid cell.

title: Create a Sensitivity Analysis heatmap plot — twsa_heatmap_plot
code: twsa_heatmap_plot(data, fill_var, x_labels, y_labels, x_title, y_title)

title: Create a Sensitivity Analysis heatmap plot — twsa_heatmap_plot
text: data data frame containing TWSA results, columns x_scale, y_scale, variable specified fill_var. fill_var string giving name column data use fill colour. x_labels character vector labels display along x-axis. y_labels character vector labels display along y-axis. x_title string specifying x-axis title. y_title string specifying y-axis title.

title: Create a Sensitivity Analysis heatmap plot — twsa_heatmap_plot
text: ggplot object representing TWSA heatmap plot.

title: Create a Sensitivity Analysis heatmap plot — twsa_heatmap_plot
text: colour scale symmetric around zero uses diverging palette distinguish positive negative values. legend labels correspond "Favours PSS", "Scenarios equal", "Favours counterfactual".

title: Create a Sensitivity Analysis heatmap plot — twsa_heatmap_plot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot <- twsa_heatmap_plot(my_data, "incremental_overdoses_scaled",   x_labels = seq(-1, 1, 0.25),   y_labels = seq(-1, 1, 0.25),   x_title = "Parameter X",   y_title = "Parameter Y" ) print(plot) } # }
